pullRequest.body:
Also shows that it is a probability measure, and that `symm` is measurable.

This deprecates two duplicate theorems.

[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/MeasureSpace.20instance.20on.20unitInterval/near/420921313)

---

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8073181123/job/22056378153)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8073181123/job/22056378314)

I thought that we use `lowerCamelCase` for definitions. Do we have `symm` as a `Homeomorph`? If yes, then you can use `Homeomorph.toMeasurableEquiv`.
Can we get it from continuity? Should it be a `@[measurability]` lemma?
@urkud, do you think this is worth having, or should I delete it?
I would remove it as it's so easy to access it from the homeomorphism.

Do you mind adding deprecated aliases for old names (`involutive_symm` and `bijective_symm` below)? Otherwise LGTM. Thanks!
bors d+

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `MeasureSpace` instance on `unitInterval`

source.title: feat: the exponential of dual numbers over non-commutative rings
